titleStmt.title: M. L. Broadwell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5636

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky:

We the undersigned citizens of Harrison County, would most respectfully represent to his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette Governer of Kentucky that at the November Term 1858, of the Harrison County Circuit Court. John Latart was in convicted of manslaughter, for killing William Doughan and by judgment of the court was ordered to be confined in the state penitentiary for the period of seven years. He was shorty afterward taken to the penitentiary, We feel fully assured that all the objects of the law, the reformation of the prisoner, being one of them, have been fully obtained, We would further represent that the father & mother of the prisoner are in very destitute circumstances, that they have no one else to look to for support, and this his assistance, which we feel assured he would give, is necessary to them. We think there is no one acquainted with the facts, but would willingly give his assent to ^the prisoners^ his being released. We ask your Excellency to extend to him the mercies
of law, and to release him from the remainder of his term.

M. L Broadwell J. H. C
J. Q. Ward Coty Atty
J L Griffith
Thomas.A. Ranken
P. Wherett ^late^ Clk Co Court
J S Boyds
G Remington
Y Y Bryent

To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette Gov of the State of Kentucky Your Peitioners respectfully state that Jno Latant was heretofore tried before the Circuit Court of Harrison County on the charge of having murdered William Dugan and a verdict was found against him for manslaughter & judgement rendered against him Condemming him to serve in the State Prison at Frankfort seven years; that about five years of the time has now Elapsed and in Consideration that the Evidence was of a doubtful character the deed having been done in a drunken brawl where five or six other men were engaged no malice was proved or pretended to have existed and the previous good character of Latart are all circumstances challenging Executive clemency in his behalf after this having served so long a time in the Prison we therefore request that he be now pardoned & released from his imprisonment

James G. Cunningham
Richard Turner
E T Debrular
E P Rose
D N Whaling
